results.title: In parliament assembled
results.brief_description: The traditions and procedures of Britain’s Parliament. An introduction by Daniel Farson is followed by interviews with General Sir Brian Horrocks (Gentleman Usher of the Black Rod), Sir Edward Bridges (Secretary to Sir Winston Churchill’s wartime Cabinet), W.S. Morrison (then Speaker of the House of Commons) and three Members of Parliament representing the principal parties. Each discusses his own part in the procedures of Parliament.
results.description: The traditions and procedures of Britain’s Parliament. An introduction by Daniel Farson is followed by interviews with General Sir Brian Horrocks (Gentleman Usher of the Black Rod), Sir Edward Bridges (Secretary to Sir Winston Churchill’s wartime Cabinet), W.S. Morrison (then Speaker of the House of Commons) and three Members of Parliament representing the principal parties. Each discusses his own part in the procedures of Parliament.
description_for_label: The traditions and procedures of Britain’s Parliament. An introduction by Daniel Farson is followed by interviews with General Sir Brian Horrocks (Gentleman Usher of the Black Rod), Sir Edward Bridges (Secretary to Sir Winston Churchill’s wartime Cabinet), W.S. Morrison (then Speaker of the House of Commons) and three Members of Parliament representing the principal parties. Each discusses his own part in the procedures of Parliament.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warnambool veterans]
results.brief_description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warnambool veterans]
results.description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [St Arnaud Veterans]
results.brief_description: While many didn’t see active service, these ten veterans from St Anaud count their time in the army as the most important part of their lives. Proud of their service, they tell of exciting adventures, adjusting to big changes and the friends they made along the way.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [St Arnaud Veterans]

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [September 2010]
results.brief_description: ACMI’s Digital Storytelling unit interviewed ten Victorian war veterans for their perspectives on life in the army, being involved in war in a different country and adjusting to life back in Australia. The personal experiences of these soldiers provide a moving memoir and a compelling historical account of Australia in wartime.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [September 2010]
results.description: ACMI’s Digital Storytelling unit interviewed ten Victorian war veterans for their perspectives on life in the army, being involved in war in a different country and adjusting to life back in Australia. The personal experiences of these soldiers provide a moving memoir and a compelling historical account of Australia in wartime.
description_for_label: ACMI’s Digital Storytelling unit interviewed ten Victorian war veterans for their perspectives on life in the army, being involved in war in a different country and adjusting to life back in Australia. The personal experiences of these soldiers provide a moving memoir and a compelling historical account of Australia in wartime.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [November 2010]
results.brief_description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their experiences through the creation of digital stories, as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [November 2010]
results.description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their experiences through the creation of digital stories, as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.
description_for_label: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their experiences through the creation of digital stories, as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Morwell veterans]
results.brief_description: Ten Victorian veterans from Morwell tell stories of their time of service, providing their unique perspectives on army life, wartime and coming home to Australia. Produced with the assistance of Morwell RSL and the students of Kurnai College, Morwell.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
description_for_label: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
